g.name: Name: Krebs cycle disorders Organism: Homo sapiens
Complex formation of SCS with NDPK is inprotant for deoxyribonucleotide salvation, which is needed for mtDNA synthesis and integrity.
Relevant metabolic pathways, illustrating the metabolic effects of succinyl-CoA sythethase deficiency
In most patient, E2 subunit seems responsible for "classic metabolic" presentation of disease

g.name: Encephalopathic form is related to E2 subunit deficiency
Clinically recognisable form of: deafness, onycho-osteodystrophy, thumbs and sensorineural deafness, is related to defect of E1 subunit.
